010package imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.linear;
011
012import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic;
013import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
014import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
015import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
016import imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
017
018/**
019 * This class represents an arbitrary linear transformation in 2D.
020 * Instances of this class and any subclass are immutable.
021 */
022public class LinearMapping2D implements Mapping2D {
023        
024        protected final double 
025                a00, a01, a02,
026                a10, a11, a12,
027                a20, a21, a22;
028
029        //  constructors -----------------------------------------------------
030        
031        /**
032         * Creates a new identity mapping.
033         */
034        public LinearMapping2D() {
035                a00 = 1; a01 = 0; a02 = 0;
036                a10 = 0; a11 = 1; a12 = 0;
037                a20 = 0; a21 = 0; a22 = 1;
038        }
039        
040        /**
041         * Creates a linear mapping from a transformation matrix A.
042         * @param A a (3,3) or (2,3) matrix
043         */
044        public LinearMapping2D(double[][] A) {
045                a00 = A[0][0]; a01 = A[0][1]; a02 = A[0][2];
046                a10 = A[1][0]; a11 = A[1][1]; a12 = A[1][2];
047                if (A.length == 3) {
048                        a20 = A[2][0]; a21 = A[2][1]; a22 = A[2][2];
049                }
050                else {
051                        a20 = 0; a21 = 0; a22 = 1;
052                }
053        }
054
055        /**
056         * Creates an arbitrary linear mapping from the specified matrix elements.
057         * @param a00 matrix element A_00
058         * @param a01 matrix element A_01
059         * @param a02 matrix element A_02
060         * @param a10 matrix element A_10
061         * @param a11 matrix element A_11
062         * @param a12 matrix element A_12
063         * @param a20 matrix element A_20
064         * @param a21 matrix element A_21
065         * @param a22 matrix element A_22
066         */
067        public LinearMapping2D (
068                        double a00, double a01, double a02, 
069                        double a10, double a11, double a12,
070                        double a20, double a21, double a22) {
071                this.a00 = a00;  this.a01 = a01;  this.a02 = a02;
072                this.a10 = a10;  this.a11 = a11;  this.a12 = a12;
073                this.a20 = a20;  this.a21 = a21;  this.a22 = a22;
074        }
075        
076        /**
077         * Creates a new linear mapping from an existing linear mapping.
078         * @param lm a given linear mapping
079         */
080        public LinearMapping2D (LinearMapping2D lm) {
081                this(lm.getTransformationMatrix());
082        }
083        
084        // ----------------------------------------------------------
085        
086        /**
087         * Scales the transformation matrix such that a22 becomes 1.
088         * Any linear mapping can be normalized and thereby be converted to
089         * a projective mapping (see {@link ProjectiveMapping2D}.
090         * @return the normalized linear mapping (i.e., a projective mapping)
091         */
092        public ProjectiveMapping2D normalize() {
093                if (Arithmetic.isZero(Math.abs(a22))) {
094                        throw new ArithmeticException("Zero value in a22, cannot normalize linear mapping!");
095                }
096                double b00 = a00/a22;   double b01 = a01/a22;   double b02 = a02/a22;
097                double b10 = a10/a22;   double b11 = a11/a22;   double b12 = a12/a22;
098                double b20 = a20/a22;   double b21 = a21/a22;
099                return new ProjectiveMapping2D(b00, b01, b02, b10, b11, b12, b20, b21);
100        }
101        
102        // ----------------------------------------------------------
103        
104        @Override
105        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d pnt) {
106                final double x = pnt.getX();
107                final double y = pnt.getY();
108                double h =  (a20 * x + a21 * y + a22);
109                double x1 = (a00 * x + a01 * y + a02) / h;
110                double y1 = (a10 * x + a11 * y + a12) / h;
111                return PntDouble.from(x1, y1);
112        }
113        
114//      @Override
115//      public double[] applyTo (double x, double y) {
116//              double h =  (a20 * x + a21 * y + a22);
117//              double x1 = (a00 * x + a01 * y + a02) / h;
118//              double y1 = (a10 * x + a11 * y + a12) / h;
119//              return new double[] {x1, y1};
120//      }
121        
122        /**
123         * Calculates and returns the inverse mapping.
124         */
125        public LinearMapping2D getInverse() {
126                // System.out.println("LinearMapping getInverse()");
127                double[][] ai = Matrix.inverse(this.getTransformationMatrix());
128                return new LinearMapping2D(ai);
129        }
130        
131        /**
132         * Concatenates this mapping A with another linear mapping B and returns
133         * a new mapping C, such that C(x) = B(A(x)).
134         * @param B the second mapping
135         * @return the concatenated mapping
136         */
137        public LinearMapping2D concat(LinearMapping2D B) {
138                double[][] C = Matrix.multiply(B.getTransformationMatrix(), this.getTransformationMatrix());
139                return new LinearMapping2D(C);
140        }
141        
142        /**
143         * Concatenates a sequence of linear mappings AA = (A1, A2, ..., An), with
144         * the result A(x) = A1(A2(...(An(x))...)). Thus, the mapping
145         * An is applied first and A1 last, with the associated transformation
146         * matrix a = a1 * a2 * ... * an.
147         * If AA is empty, the identity mapping is returned.
148         * If AA contains only a single mapping, a copy of this mapping is returned.
149         * 
150         * @param AA a (possibly empty) sequence of linear transformations
151         * @return the concatenated linear transformation 
152         */
153        public static LinearMapping2D concatenate(LinearMapping2D... AA) {
154                if (AA.length == 0) {
155                        return new LinearMapping2D();   // identity
156                }
157                else {
158                        double[][] a = AA[0].getTransformationMatrix();
159                        for (int i = 1; i < AA.length; i++) {
160                                a = Matrix.multiply(a, AA[i].getTransformationMatrix());
161                        }
162                        return new LinearMapping2D(a);
163                }
164        }
165        
166        /**
167         * Retrieves the transformation matrix for this mapping.
168         * @return the 3x3 transformation matrix
169         */
170        public double[][] getTransformationMatrix() {
171                return new double[][]
172                                {{a00, a01, a02},
173                                 {a10, a11, a12},
174                                 {a20, a21, a22}};
175        }
176
177        /**
178         * Returns a copy of this mapping.
179         * @return a new mapping of the same type
180         */
181        public LinearMapping2D duplicate() {
182                return new LinearMapping2D(this);
183        }
184
185        public String toString() {
186                return Matrix.toString(getTransformationMatrix());
187        }
188        
189        // -----------------------------------------------------------
190        
191//      /**
192//       * For testing only.
193//       * @param args ignored
194//       */
195//      public static void main(String[] args) {
196//              PrintPrecision.set(6);
197//              double[][] A = 
198//                              {{-1.230769, 2.076923, -1.769231}, 
199//                              {-2.461538, 2.615385, -3.538462}, 
200//                              {-0.307692, 0.230769, 1.000000}};
201//              System.out.println("A = " + Matrix.toString(A));
202//              
203//              double[][] Ai = Matrix.inverse(A);
204//              System.out.println("Ai = " + Matrix.toString(Ai));
205//              
206//              double[][] I = Matrix.multiply(A, Ai);
207//              System.out.println("\ntest: should be the  identity matrix: = \n" + Matrix.toString(I));
208//              
209//              ProjectiveMapping pA = (new LinearMapping2D(A)).normalize();
210//              System.out.println("mapping pA = \n" + pA.toString());
211//              
212//              ProjectiveMapping AA1 = pA.concat(pA);
213//              System.out.println("mapping AA1 = \n" + AA1.toString());
214//              
215//              ProjectiveMapping AA2 = LinearMapping2D.concatenate(pA, pA).normalize();
216//              System.out.println("mapping AA1 = \n" + AA2.toString());
217//      }
218
219
220        
221}
222
